title: Ping muting testing soon
body:
EDIT: Functionality, details

Hey everyone, 

Earlier today we shipped some code for ping muting to PBE. We'll be turning it on for testing on PBE in the next few days, and hope to have it live around the world within just a couple patches. This is a new button we're adding to the tab menu. It'll axe standard, smart, and HUD pings from the player you ping mute. 

The mute button that's already in the game is not moving or changing at all. It mutes chat, and extracurricular animations and emotes. The idea is to give everyone granular mute controls.

Let me iterate; 

#I'm all for muting pings

I never anywhere said I was against this policy from Riot.

What I'm trying to do **is bring clarity to their position of muting pings versus their position of punishing players for ignoring the team completely**.

Before, you could do /mute all and it's completely acceptable, because Riot said "you have the ability to communicate via 'smart pings'".

Now they're removing the ability to have smart pings _as well_.

I want to make sure Riot is held accountable to themselves to not punish players anymore for _any_ "communication failures" _whatsoever_ once they introduce this functionality. Otherwise, it would be extremely hypocritical of them.

>But let's say I /mute all chat and mute everyone's pings at the start of the game....

>Let's say someone else also does the same on my team...

Preemptively muting your whole team may have consequences. That is a personal decision you are making.

Pings by ping muted players will not be visible, audible, nor messaged in chat. From your perspective, it will be as if those pings never happened.

It's a feature that's meant to be used selectively in cases where you feel like someone's pings aren't valuable to you, as opposed to pre-emptively against your entire team.

then what is going to be done to PREVENT pre emptive ping muting? people already /mute all.

Generally speaking, I'd hope and expect that: A) a desire to win the match, and B) a realization that communication and teamwork are a tool in your arsenal that'll increase your odds of winning would both motivate people not to blanket remove all their channels of communication.

As a thought exercise, suppose a player does have good and/or personal reasons for muting all chats and all pings in some or all of their matches. Would this still be a problem? And if so, how would you go about addressing it while respecting a player's personal choice to do so?

I feel like one of the reasons people regularly /mute all is because they know typed comms are rarely productive (not to mention it's often inefficient gameplay to stop csing/moving to type) and because they know the potentially important stuff can be communicated via pings in a faster and clearer manner. 

I'm unclear on why someone would pre-emptively pingmute someone by contrast.

For the same reason players preemptively /mute all...

Too many toxic players spam pings.

That strikes me as a good reason to allow pingmuting rather than the pingmute everyone premptively, since it's rarely more than one or two players ping spamming.

But if someone is super prone to ping spam related tilt so that they do pre-emptively ping mute everyone, isn't that something they should be allowed to do, potentially for their own teams benefit? I'd rather have an unresponsive player (who if they're in habit of pingmuting everyone should be used to keeping a close eye on their minimap) playing at their best (perhaps handicapped best with no pings), than a tilted player who might just do retaliation ping spams anyway.

(And someones ping muting everyone doesn't prevent them from using their own pings, so they could still be communicating in their own output-only fashion.)
